qas.question: What location is the birthplace of IBM?
How many gallons of liquid cleaning agent leaked from an IBM facility in 1979?
How long did IBM use liquid cleaning agents for circuit board manufacturing?
Starting in 1980 how many gallons of chemicals did IBM pump into the air?
IBM was identified by what department as a major source of pollution?
What has drinking water been contaminated with for decades, making it unsafe in Endicott?
When did freon leak from an underground tank in Endicott?
How many gallons of freon leaked into the town's soil in 1979?
How many people were diagnosed with cancer in 1980 near Endicott?
What was a local dry cleaner found to be the main source of in 1979?

context: The birthplace of IBM, <a0_0>Endicott<a0_0/>, suffered pollution for decades, however. IBM used liquid cleaning agents in circuit board assembly operation for <a2_0>more than two decades<a2_0/>, and six spills and leaks were recorded, including one leak in <b6_0>1979<b6_0/> of <a1_0><b7_0>4,100<b7_0/> gallons<a1_0/> from an underground tank. These left behind volatile organic compounds in the town's soil and aquifer. Traces of <b5_0>volatile organic compounds<b5_0/> have been identified in Endicott’s drinking water, but the levels are within regulatory limits. Also, from 1980, IBM has pumped out <a3_0><b8_0>78,000<b8_0/> gallons<a3_0/> of chemicals, including trichloroethane, freon, benzene and perchloroethene to the air and allegedly caused several cancer cases among the townspeople. IBM Endicott has been identified by the <a4_0>Department of Environmental Conservation<a4_0/> as the major source of <b9_0>pollution<b9_0/>, though traces of contaminants from a local dry cleaner and other polluters were also found. Remediation and testing are ongoing, however according to city officials, tests show that the water is safe to drink.
